utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, how are things going with your parents?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, speaking of attorneys, if I ever needed a lawyer, I would not hire She-Hulk.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what? That was almost on topic. I’m gonna say good job, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Wait, She-Hulk’s a lawyer?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, she works at a law firm in New York.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, but she’s the only monster at the firm. Between you, me and the wall, I think she’s an affirmative action hire.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Anyway, Dad’s gonna be here in town, so I won’t be able to do Christmas dinner this year.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: If you’re not up to hosting Christmas dinner, I’m happy to do it. You can even bring your father.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That would be nice.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’ve always wanted to do a traditional Victorian Christmas. Parlour games, goose and figgy pudding.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ugh. English pudding. You get yourself all excited for pudding, and here comes a cake with raisins in it. I’m not going.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re going.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why do you hate me?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t hate you. I love you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you call it love, but it has a lot of raisins in it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Amy, good luck getting these guys excited about a dinner with a theme. I gave up when no one cared about my Tom Hanks-giving.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I think a Victorian Christmas sounds nice.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I agree.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You guys suck.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know the best part of working in the clean room? No allergies. Check it out. Oh, that, that, that’s a lot of oxygen.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We should get going to Amy’s.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can you believe there was a time when we would have needed an array of giant Cherenkov telescopes to detect cosmic particles? And here we are building our own multi-wire detector like a couple of badasses.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know. If we were still single, we’d be tripping over all that booty.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ladies do love a man dressed like a kitchen garbage bag. Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How the hell did a pigeon get in here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You shut the loading doors, right?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I thought you did.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you know what a disaster this is?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You mean ’cause this room isn’t supposed to have dust in it, and we just let in a flying crap machine?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do we do? Should we call someone?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And tell them that we compromised all the equipment? Let’s just get it out of here before anyone knows.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, how do we catch it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, what if we turn off all the lights except for one, and it’ll come to it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not a moth.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t yell at me. You’re not gonna get any good ideas out of me if you’re yelling.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, so if I remain calm, I’ll get more gems like turn off the lights?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great, we’re turning on each other. That’s just what the bird wants us to do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, Dr. Koothrappali, long flight?

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Twenty hours.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s rough.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Not at all. Did you know that when you fly transcontinental without your wife, you don’t pray for the plane to crash?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can we please talk about anything else?

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Forgive me. How are you and Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, great. Everything’s good.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: I see you got engaged.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, we did.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Let me tell you a story.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Sorry. I’m sure you won’t grow to hate each other.

utterance.speaker: Raj (on phone)
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard. What’s up? What? How did that happen? Yeah, okay. I’ll be there as soon as I can. Sorry. I have to run to the university.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: There’s been a problem with an experiment. A bird got into the clean room.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: You want me to come?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, no. You had a long flight. You stay here and relax.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Relax. Easy for you to say. Your mother isn’t cleaning out your bank account. Forty years, the woman never cleaned a thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re just gonna leave him here?

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Relax, he says.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yup. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (singing)
utterance.content: Here comes Santa Claus, here comes Santa Claus, right down Santa Claus Lane. Vixen and Blitzen and all his reindeer pulling on the reins.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I appreciate the ride.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (singing)
utterance.content: Bells are ringing, children singing, all is merry and bright. So hang your stockings and say your prayers ’cause Santa Claus is coming tonight. Why’d you turn it off?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because in the last ten minutes, Santa came to town, kissed Mommy and ran Grandma over with a reindeer. I had a drunk uncle who did all those things. Nobody sings songs about him.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Maybe you’d like it more if you thought of Santa as a superhero and his power is bringing joy to children.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My uncle was accused of that, too. It turned out to be legal in Oklahoma.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay, new subject. Let’s talk about presents. What did you get Amy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, we’re not exchanging gifts.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come on, Sheldon, you have to get her something.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why should I? She knows that I don’t like Christmas, and yet, every year, she forces me to celebrate it. Not only am I going to this foolish dinner against my will, at the Christmas tree lot, there was mistletoe, and she kissed me under it in public. Like we were the stars of a Tijuana sex show.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: She’s just excited about the holidays.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, and she’s not taking my feelings into account at all. Maybe it’s time I teach her a lesson.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm. It’d have to be something heinous, something that makes her as miserable as she’s making me. Oh, I’ve got it. This is good.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m going to buy her a present.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re gonna have to walk me through that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: With gift-giving, there’s an implied social contract. If I show up tonight with a present, and she doesn’t have one for me, she’ll feel terrible.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Then you’re both sad?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Maybe she’ll feel so guilty, she’ll never make me celebrate the holidays again.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So your evil plot here is to buy your girlfriend a present?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s right. So stay on my good side, or I’ll get you a little something, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, here’s the plan. I’m gonna put the food in the bag, and when he lands in the bag to eat it, we close it up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A Slim Jim?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s all I could find. It’ll work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure. If the pigeon’s stoned or a trucker.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, well, what’s your plan?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I told you my plan. Let’s call Building Services and get help.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And admit that we contaminated the clean room?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, admit that you contaminated the clean room.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why do you keep assuming it was me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because you do this kind of thing all the time, and then you try to cover it up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Like when?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about when you flipped the Mars Rover, or lost Koothrappali’s dog, or almost drove off with that baby?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Again, it looked like my car, and the baby didn’t even cry until his mother punched me with her keys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine, put the Slim Jim in the garbage bag.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, what if you said it without sounding so condescending?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can try, but your plan has the words garbage bag and Slim Jim in it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Genius here wants to catch a bird with a garbage bag and a Slim Jim.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Should have put it in the bag first.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, if you don’t mind me asking, do you think you might start dating again?

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: It’s much too soon for that. Why? Do you know someone?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, but if things don’t work out with me and Leonard, I’ll give you a call. Wait. How much do you talk about Star Trek?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, let’s get this Victorian party started. I’ve done some research about some traditional parlour games we can play.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, there’s a fun one called Ball of Wool. You take a ball of wool, and you put it right in the centre of the table. Then people sit on opposite sides of the table and try to blow the wool off.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sorry. She’s taken, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know what I think your problem is? You’re jealous because you and I used to be best friends until Koothrappali came along.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And you found somebody you could push around?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stay out of this.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, maybe I’m best friends with Raj because he doesn’t think he’s smarter than me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I said, stay out of it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, no. No, Raj, go ahead, say what you were gonna say.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All I’m gonna say is you guys need to stop this right now. It. it’s bad enough that my parents are fighting, now I have to hear the two of you? And who cares who’s smarter? If it’s Leonard or me or, you know, it’s Christmas, let’s say it’s Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, if you’re so smart, you get the bird out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, you’re the one who let him in.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How do you know it wasn’t Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What about that sweater?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it’s not good enough. It has to be perfect.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I think the nicest gifts I’ve got from Howie show how well he knows me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm. Let’s see, what do I know about Amy? She loves medieval literature, Chaucer’s her favourite. And her eyes sparkle when she watches old French movies. I enjoy how harp music causes her fingers to dance as if she’s playing along.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wow, you really do love her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I do. Now, let’s find the kind of gift that makes her feel small and worthless.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You won.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Certainly doesn’t feel like it, does it?

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: You know, my wife used to throw theme parties like this all the time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I guess that’s where Raj gets it from.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Well, he and his mother spent a lot of time together when he was young. I was always working.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, you know, Raj is dating a doctor who works a lot. Him and his mom have a type. You, you got to laugh at that, right? No? All right.

utterance.speaker: Santa
utterance.content: All right, let me see if I’ve got this straight. A picture of you on my lap is a way to punish your girlfriend for making you celebrate Christmas?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Correct.

utterance.speaker: Santa
utterance.content: Santa thinks dating you may be punishment enough.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s an argument for that. But I want to make sure.

utterance.speaker: Photographer
utterance.content: Smile.

utterance.speaker: Santa
utterance.content: Ho, ho. ho.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. On the count of three, I’ll shoot the fire extinguisher and get him airborne. Howard, you wave the blanket and guide him towards the exit. Raj, you hold open the curtain so he can fly out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Are you sure a dummy like me can handle something as complicated as a blanket?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you want the fire extinguisher?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I do.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay. One, two, three.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, you have to take the pin out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You miss the blanket now, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: On three. One, two, three.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was an accident. Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Relax, it wasn’t your fault.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh, maybe it’s just stunned.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, it’s not breathing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, no. I killed it. Oh, not again.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What do you mean, not again?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: When I was ten, I was playing in my backyard and sat on a blue jay. I mean, I tried to bring it back to life with electricity, but it just caught on fire. The worst part was it smelled delicious.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, guys, I found an article here that says you can do CPR on birds.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great. Do it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not doing it. You killed him, you do it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. I need to do it. This is on me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. Mouth over beak and light chest compressions.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Don’t blow too hard. If you pop him, I will vomit.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I am tasting a lot of Slim Jim.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, wait, his wing moved.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, he blinked his eyes. He’s alive.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s a Christmas miracle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I might argue a Hanukkah miracle, but I’ll take it. Come on, little guy, let’s get you outside. Get the curtain.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Someone should really close that loading door.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, that’s that. The room’s compromised. They’ll have to change all the filters, probably shut it down for weeks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You were right. Go ahead, call Building Services. Tell them it was my fault.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, we’re both to blame. You know, let me take the heat on this one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, just leave me out of it. You know if they come here and see crap everywhere, they’re just gonna blame the Indian guy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (on phone)
utterance.content: Hey. I’m sorry, we’re still here. Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s kind of boring. Although it did get exciting for a minute when Amy inhaled a wool ball. How much longer do you think you’ll be?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. There’s still a bird in here. We are gonna get in a ton of trouble.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Honey, it’s Christmas Eve. Who even knows you’re in there?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, our names are on the sign-in sheet.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So erase them and walk out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Can’t do what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She says take our names off the sign-in sheet and leave.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard, Howard and Raj (singing)
utterance.content: Jingle bells, jingle bells, jingle all the way. Oh, what fun it is to ride in a one-horse open sleigh, hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mmm. Amy, that pudding was delicious.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If you like raisins.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you. And it’s figs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, in that case, it was pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You feeling okay? You hardly touched your goose.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It smelled too much like blue jay.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Can I help you clean up?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, you Heimliched a ball of wool out of me; you’re good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, what do you say we exchange gifts?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Sheldon, we didn’t bring any.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought you hate giving gifts.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I do. Which is why I got Amy this.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You got me something?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, not just something, no. It’s from the heart, it’s holiday-themed, and I swallowed the gift receipt so you cannot return it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Look at you on Santa’s lap. That’s so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course it is. It’s the perfect gift. How are you feeling right now? Guilty? Sad? Wishing you were Jewish?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, I love it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, really? Well, how about now? Happy holidays to my dear Amy. I hope you treasure this as much as I treasure you. And you got me nothing. Christmas is ruined. Let’s never speak of it again. Well, this was fun.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Actually, I did get you something.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But what about our agreement?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, you got me something. Here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cookies?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: They’re your Meemaw’s Christmas cookies. I called and got the recipe.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They’re perfect. It tastes like her hugs.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Merry Christmas, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t believe this. You’re happy, I’m happy. Well, maybe a holiday that’s all about giving isn’t so… Get your hand out of that box.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. The next game is called Hot Boiled Beans.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course it is.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: One person is sent out of the room while the others hide a small item. Then they invite the first person back by saying hot boiled beans and bacon for supper, hurry up before it gets cold.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If you people think this is better than Tom Hanks-giving, you’re all crazy.
